member.name: T:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.pdfjobs.jobs.AutotagPDFJob
member.summary: A job that creates PDF documents with enhanced readability from existing PDF documents. An optional tagging report can also be generated which contains the information about the tags that the tagged output PDF document contains. Accessibility tags, used by assistive technology such as screen reader are required to make PDF files compliant. However, the generated PDF is not guaranteed to comply with accessibility standards such as WCAG and PDF/UA as there could be a need to perform further downstream remediation to meet those standards.

member.name: T:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.pdfjobs.jobs.HTMLToPDFJob
member.summary:
* A job that converts a HTML file to a PDF file. Some source formats may have associated conversion parameters which can be set using the {@link HTMLToPDFParams} parameter.
An HTML input can be provided either as a local zip archive or as a static HTML file with inline CSS. Alternatively, an HTML can also be specified via URL.
While creating the corresponding Asset instance, the media type must be:
"application/zip", if the input is a local zip archive.
"text/html", if the input is a static HTML file with inline CSS
In case the input is a local zip archive, it must have the following structure:
The main HTML file must be named "index.html".
"index.html" must exist at the top level of zip archive, not in a folder.
Sample layout:
html_files.zip |__index.html |__referenced_file_1.css |__referenced_file_2.jpeg |__subfolder_1 |_____referenced_file_3.jpeg

member.name: T:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.pdfjobs.jobs.ProtectPDFJob
member.summary:
A job that is used for securing PDF document with password(s). The password(s) is used for encrypting the PDF document and setting the restriction on certain features like printing, editing and copying in the PDF document.
The supported algorithm for encrypting the PDF document are listed here. The {@link EncryptionAlgorithm} enum can be used to set the encryption algorithm.
AES-128
AES-256
For AES-128 encryption the password supports LATIN-I characters only. For AES-256 encryption the password supports Unicode character set.

member.name: F:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.pdfjobs.parameters.compresspdf.CompressionLevel.LOW
member.summary: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 250 dpi to 200 dpi (dots per inch). This option uses JP2K high quality compression.

member.name: F:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.pdfjobs.parameters.compresspdf.CompressionLevel.MEDIUM
member.summary: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 200 dpi to 144 dpi (dots per inch). This option uses JP2K medium quality compression.

member.name: F:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.pdfjobs.parameters.compresspdf.CompressionLevel.HIGH
member.summary: Reduces the file size of pdf by reducing resolution of the coloured and grayscale images above 100 dpi to 72 dpi (dots per inch). This option uses JPEG medium quality compression. Output pdf will not contain hidden layers, document structure, metadata, javascript, user properties and print settings.

member.name: T:Adobe.PDFServicesSDK.PDFServices
member.summary:
This class is the entry point for all the PDF Service utilities. These utilities can be used to perform various functions such as submitting , getting status of a , getting result of a , uploading , getting content of an , deleting an and refreshing an .
Methods provided by the utility are:
Upload (or Assets)
Submit
Get status of a
Get result of a
Get content of
Delete
Refresh

Uploads content from an input stream and returns an to be used in PDF Services SDK.
Method will not close the input stream, responsibility of closing the input stream lies with the client.
